Developments with exceptionally high utilities demands, such as data centres, must demonstrate that these requirements will not undermine the deliverability of planned homes and developments in the borough. Where this cannot be demonstrated, development proposals may be refused, or be subject to providing sufficient capacity ahead of delivery. 11.76 Part 1(d) requires applicants to demonstrate that new or expanded utilities infrastructure will not have any negative impacts to amenity or environment, such as noise, odour or vibration, or that any identified impacts will be mitigated.
